title: Global Workday - HRIS Integration Professional
content:
COMPANY OVERVIEW
KKR & Co. Inc., together with its subsidiaries, is a leading global investment firm that offers alternative asset management and capital markets and insurance solutions. KKR aims to generate attractive investment returns by following a patient and disciplined investment approach, employing world-class people, and supporting growth in its portfolio companies and communities. KKR sponsors investment funds that invest in private equity, credit and real assets and has strategic partners that manage hedge funds. KKR’s insurance subsidiaries offer retirement, life and reinsurance products under the management of The Global Atlantic Financial Group. KKR's Gurugram office will provide best in class services and solutions to our internal stakeholders and clients, drive organization wide process efficiency and transformation, and reflect KKR's global culture and values of teamwork and innovation. The office will contain multifunctional business capabilities and will be integral in furthering the growth and transformation of KKR.
TEAM OVERVIEW
KKR’s Human Capital team applies collaborative efforts and an entrepreneurial mindset to ensure that our core values, teamwork, integrity, innovation and diversity, are instilled at every aspect of our firm.  The Human Capital team is involved throughout our employees’ life cycle to provide support to all firm-wide teams to deliver outstanding performance. The four pillars of the Human Capital team are the Business Partners, Talent Acquisition, DEI and Talent Development and our Total Rewards, Benefits/ Wellness, Human Capital Technology, Analytics, and Operations teams.
POSITION SUMMARY
This individual will play a pivotal role in supporting our Human Capital team by developing and maintaining seamless integrations between Human Capital and other business systems and optimizing efficient processes. This hire will help ensure the efficient and effective flow of data across systems to improve HC processes such as benefits administration and employee data management. In addition, this hire will leverage their technical expertise to build robust, scalable integrations, troubleshoot issues, and provide ongoing support for HC operations. This hire’s contribution will be crucial in optimizing HR functionalities, enabling data-driven decision-making, and improving the overall employee experience.
Key Responsibilities:

Develop, maintain, and support a variety of complex integrations using Workday Studio, EIB, Core Connectors, RaaS, and other Workday integration technologies.
Collaborate with Human Capital, Technology, and other business stakeholders to gather and understand integration requirements.
Translate business requirements into technical solutions, ensuring that solutions are efficient, scalable, and meet business needs.
Perform regular system upgrades and patch management to ensure Workday integrations function correctly with other systems.
Troubleshoot and resolve integration issues in a timely manner, collaborating with Workday support as needed.
Develop and maintain documentation for integration designs, technical specifications, and best practices.
Additional responsibilities include configuring business processes, supporting system testing, and building custom reports and calculated fields.
Provide training and mentorship to other team members on Workday integration methodologies and best practices.
Stay updated with the latest trends and best practices in Workday integrations.

 
Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field
3+ years of experience in Workday integrations, specifically with Workday Studio, EIB, and Core Connectors
Demonstrable knowledge of Web Services, XSLT, XML, and other integration-related technologies
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Ability to work both independently and collaboratively in a team environment
Familiarity with the Workday ecosystem, including HCM, Benefits, and Workday Extend is a plus

 KKR is an equal opportunity employer.  Individuals seeking employment are considered without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, or any other category protected by applicable law.
